javadoc:
The inteface for SettingsDefinitions that have boolean values.  SettingsDefinitions
 objects are used as keys into Settings objects that contain the values using a name-value
 type storage mechanism.

methods.name: getValue
methods.comment: gets the value for this SettingsDefinition given a Settings object.

params.name: settings
params.comment: the set of Settings values for a particular location or null for default value.

return.comment: the values for this settings object given the context.

methods.name: setValue
methods.comment: Sets the given value into the given settings object using this settingsDefinition as the key.

params.name: settings
params.comment: the settings object to store the value in.

params.name: value
params.comment: the value to store in the settings object using this settingsDefinition as the key.

name: BooleanSettingsDefinition
comment:
The inteface for SettingsDefinitions that have boolean values.  SettingsDefinitions
 objects are used as keys into Settings objects that contain the values using a name-value
 type storage mechanism.
